title: Deep elf sorcerer
data:
***Version [0.26](/0.26 "0.26")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*For a list of all deep elves, see [list of deep elves](/List_of_deep_elves "List of deep elves").*

| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | A mighty spellcaster who draws power from the very Hells, and possesses lethal arcane abilities. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Deep elf sorcerers** are deadly deep elven casters with a deadly variety of spells. They are commonly found in the lower portions of the [Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls"), particularly within the massive treasure vault, but they may also be found in the upper portions of that branch and wandering [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults") and [the Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths") in deep elf bands.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                           |                                                     |
| :---------- | --------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Corrosive Bolt](/Corrosive_Bolt "Corrosive Bolt") (3d21) | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Banishment](/Banishment "Banishment")                    | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Haste](/Haste "Haste")                                   | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot4       | [Hurl Damnation](/Hurl_Damnation "Hurl Damnation") (3d20) | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Like most of the more powerful deep elf opponents, deep elf sorcerers should be a high priority. They might deal less direct damage than a [deep elf annihilator](/Deep_elf_annihilator "Deep elf annihilator"), but they can still pile on damage quickly with damnation, [corrode](/Corrode "Corrode") you with Corrosive Bolt, and if you aren't high enough level to deal with [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"), treat them with caution and pile on whatever sources of additional willpower you can.
- If you can get close enough to [silence](/Silence "Silence") one, you can tear it apart in melee. Just be prepared to take heavy damage from acid or damnation or a sudden trip to the Abyss if you have to charge in. Lure the sorcerer around corners or nuke it at range as fast as you can if you don't think you can close the distance quickly.

## History

Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), Deep elf sorcerers knew [Summon Demon](/Summon_Demon "Summon Demon").

Deep elf sorcerer

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.26: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all deep elves, see list of deep elves.

deep elf sorcerer e 
HP 41-84
HD 14
XP 1724
Speed 10
AC 1
EV 12
Will 120
Attack1 12 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type elf, elf
Flags
See invisible
Speaks
Warm-blooded
A mighty spellcaster who draws power from the very Hells, and possesses lethal arcane abilities.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Deep elf sorcerers are deadly deep elven casters with a deadly variety of spells. They are commonly found in the lower portions of the Elven Halls, particularly within the massive treasure vault, but they may also be found in the upper portions of that branch and wandering the Vaults and the Depths in deep elf bands.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Corrosive Bolt (3d21) Wizard flag
Slot2 Banishment Wizard flag
Slot3 Haste Wizard flag
Slot4 Hurl Damnation (3d20) Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Like most of the more powerful deep elf opponents, deep elf sorcerers should be a high priority. They might deal less direct damage than a deep elf annihilator, but they can still pile on damage quickly with damnation, corrode you with Corrosive Bolt, and if you aren't high enough level to deal with the Abyss, treat them with caution and pile on whatever sources of additional willpower you can.
  • If you can get close enough to silence one, you can tear it apart in melee. Just be prepared to take heavy damage from acid or damnation or a sudden trip to the Abyss if you have to charge in. Lure the sorcerer around corners or nuke it at range as fast as you can if you don't think you can close the distance quickly.

History

Prior to 0.18, Deep elf sorcerers knew Summon Demon.
